conclusion: Analyze electrical and magnetic interactions to calculate actual power of lamp L2.
Identify given values: Power of lamp L1 is 3W, Power of lamp L2 is 6W, Resistance of rails is 1 Ohm, Distance between rails is 0.6m, Magnetic induction is 1T.
Calculate current in lamp L1: I1 = 1A.
Calculate current in lamp L2: I2 = 1A.
Since current in both lamps is the same, magnetic force on each lamp is the same: F = BIL.
Magnetic force is equal to work done on conductor rod per unit length: F = P2/r = 6N.
Work done on conductor rod per unit length is equal to change in kinetic energy.
Since magnetic force is constant, kinetic energy is also constant: Kinetic Energy = 3.6J.
Since conductor rod moves at constant speed v, power P2 is given by: P2 = F * v.
The actual power P2 of lamp L2 is 11.76W.
